body_html:
Yes, it certainly is.

The Windows specific-ness of that is questionable See #9780 (comment).

Though in practice this hasn't been a concern that has shown up much over the past year and hence resolving that hasn't been bumped up the priority list. If you do have some reason to believe that the int32 casting and the resulting copies is indeed causing trouble, please do file a bug with the details.

(Keeping this particular one closed since this concern about int32 casting and copies isn't specific to the original description of the issue)

Hope that makes sense. Thanks.

body:
Yes, it certainly is. 

The Windows specific-ness of that is questionable See https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/9780#issuecomment-323547672.

Though in practice this hasn't been a concern that has shown up much over the past year and hence resolving that hasn't been bumped up the priority list. If you do have some reason to believe that the int32 casting and the resulting copies is indeed causing trouble, please do file a bug with the details.

(Keeping this particular one closed since this concern about int32 casting and copies isn't specific to the original description of the issue)

Hope that makes sense. Thanks.
